timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            For timeSpans, you can specify an end date but it is not used by operator fabric (it was intended for future uses but it will be deprecated)
          
          
            
            For timeSpans, you can specify an end date but it is not implemented in OperatorFabric (it was intended for future uses but it will be deprecated).
timeline.author: AlexGuironnetRTE
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -210,22 +220,5 @@ card:
 In this sample, the card will be displayed twice in the time line. The card
 start date will be ignored.
 
-*example 2:*
-
-Instead of the default clustered view, you may want your card to be displayed
-as a line in the time line.
-
-....
-{
-	"publisher":"TSO1",
-	"publisherVersion":"0.1",
-	"processId":"process-000",
-	"startDate":1546297200000,
-	"severity":"INFORMATION",
-	...
-	"timeSpans" : [
-        {"start" : 1546297200000, "end" : 1546297500000}
-    ]
 
-}
-....
+For timeSpans, you can specify an end date but it is not used by operator fabric (it was intended for future uses but it will be deprecated)

@@ -183,11 +194,10 @@ If the `publisherVersion` of the card is `2` then only the `title` key declared
 
 When the simple startDate and endDate are not enough to characterize your

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Unique identifier of the card in the OperatorFabric system. This attribute can be send with card, but normally it's manage by `OperatorFabric` system.
          
          
            
            Unique identifier of the card in the OperatorFabric system. This attribute can be sent with card, but by default it's managed by OperatorFabric.
timeline.author: AlexGuironnetRTE
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -110,10 +96,35 @@ ifdef::single-page-doc[<<display_rules, Display rules>>]
 ifndef::single-page-doc[<<{gradle-rootdir}/documentation/current/reference_doc/index.adoc#display_rules, Display rules>>]
 for some examples.
 
+
+
+=== Optional information
+
+==== Tags (`tag`)
+
+Tags are intended to enable filter of cards in the feed of the GUI.
+
+==== EntityRecipients (`entityRecipients`)
+
+Use to send to cards to entity : all users members of the entities listed will receive the card. If it is used in conjonction with groups recipients, users must be member of one of the entities AND one of the groups to received the cards.
+
+
 === Last Time to Decide (`lttd`)
 
 Fixes the moment until when a `actions` associated to the card are available. After then, the associated actions won't be displayed or actionable.
 
+=== Store information 
+
+==== uid (`uid`)
+
+Unique identifier of the card in the OperatorFabric system. This attribute can be send with card, but normally it's manage by `OperatorFabric` system.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            With this attributes OperatorFabric know when to display or hide cards.
          
          
            
            With this attributes OperatorFabric knows when to display or hide cards.
timeline.author: AlexGuironnetRTE
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -75,23 +75,9 @@ ifdef::single-page-doc[<<display_rules, Display rules>>]
 ifndef::single-page-doc[<<{gradle-rootdir}/documentation/current/reference_doc/index.adoc#display_rules, Display rules>>]
 . Without recipient declaration a card is useless in `OperatorFabric` system.
 
-=== Store information
-
-==== Tags (`tag`)
-
-Tags are intended to enable filter of cards in the feed of the GUI.
-
-==== uid (`uid`)
-
-Unique identifier of the card in the OperatorFabric system. This attribute can be send with card, but normally it's manage by `OperatorFabric` system.
-
-==== id (`id`)
-
-State id of the associated process, determined by `OperatorFabric` can be set arbitrarily by the `publisher`.
-
 === Card Life Management Configuration
 
-With this attributes OperatorFabric know when to display or hide cards, but also if an action is still available for a given card.
+With this attributes OperatorFabric know when to display or hide cards.

timeline.message:
Apply suggestions from code review

Fixing wording and typos
